item.title: Manda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Manda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Manda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Manda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Manda add a quote by S.I. Hayakawa
item.description: "It is not true that 'we have only one life to live'; if we can read, we can live as many more lives and as many kinds of lives as we wish." -- S.I. Hayakawa

item.title: Manda add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Manda add a quote by Victor Nell
item.description: "Books are all the dreams we would most like to have and like dreams they have the power to change consciousness. " -- Victor Nell

item.title: Manda add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Manda add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "In each of us lie good and bad, light and dark, art and pain, choice and regret, cruelty and sacrifice. We’re each of us our own chiaroscuro, our own bit of illusion fighting to emerge into something solid, something real. We’ve got to forgive ourselves that. I must remember to forgive myself. Because there is a lot of grey to work with. No one can live in the light all the time." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "People have a habit of inventing fictions they will believe wholeheartedly in order to ignore the truth they cannot accept." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "That's what living in their world is-a big lie. An illusion where everyone looks the other way and pretends that nothing unpleasant exists at all, no goblins of the dark, no ghosts of the soul." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "There are no safe choices, Miss Temple. Only other choices." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "And for a moment, I understand that I have friends on this lonely path; that sometimes your place is not something you find, but something you have when you need it." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I know because I read...Your mind is not a cage. It's a garden. And it requires cultivating." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "What if evil doesn't really exist? What if evil is something dreamed up by man, and there is nothing to struggle against except out own limitations? The constant battle between our will, our desires, and our choices?" -- Libba Bray

item.title: Manda add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Manda add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "When I dream, I dream of him. For several nights now he’s come to me, waving from a distant shore as if he’s been waiting patiently for me to arrive. He doesn’t utter a word, but his smile says everything: I’ve missed you." -- Libba Bray
